item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The reason that fiction is more interesting than any other form of literature, to those who really like to study people, is that in fiction the author can really tell the truth without humiliating himself." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "We are afraid to care too much, for fear that the other person does not care at all." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Learn from the mistakes of others. You can’t live long enough to make them all yourself. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Imagine yourself as a living house. God comes in to rebuild that house. At first, perhaps, you can understand what He is doing. He is getting the drains right and stopping the leaks in the roof and so on; you knew that those jobs needed doing and so you are not surprised. But presently He starts knocking the house about in a way that hurts abominably and does not seem to make any sense. What on earth is He up to? The explanation is that He is building quite a different house from the one you thought of - throwing out a new wing here, putting on an extra floor there, running up towers, making courtyards. You thought you were being made into a decent little cottage: but He is building a palace. He intends to come and live in it Himself." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Charles Spurgeon
item.description: "Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom." -- Charles Spurgeon

item.title: Colleen add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein
